programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: Comedy drama series from A Touch of Frost writer Richard Harris. Detective Constable 'Dangerous' Davies is an obstinate traditionalist used to being given bottom-of-the-pile jobs at his north London station until a routine inquiry offers him a lead in a 20-year-old unsolved murder case. Enlisting the help of his eccentric drinking buddy Mod Lewis, the mild-mannered detective sets out to prove himself to his colleagues. Peter Davison and Sean Hughes star

Chris Packham is in Greenland to learn more about the rate at which snow and ice are melting and retreating in the Arctic. programme.desc: A black couple's first date takes a shocking turn when a traffic stop leads to the killing of the police officer in self-defence, and the fugitive pair hit the road for a life-changing journey. Crime drama, starring Daniel Kaluuya, Jodie Turner-Smith and Bokeem Woodbine

programme.title: Breakfast

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure

programme.title: Paramedics on Scene

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Nina tries to stand up to Auntie Binita, and Rich has news for Kirsty and Ollie. Bear uncovers a tragic story when a woman turns up at the Mill with no memory of how she got there

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team visits Bristol to help a busy household of nine young professionals. Their communal areas are in desperate need of some attention - the overcrowded living room needs seating and storage solutions, the recycling area is overflowing and the downstairs wet room proves a cleaning challenge for Maxine Dwyer

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple looking for a home by the sea in Devon or Dorset, and rides a three-wheeled bicycle with a scheme which helps people to explore the area's coastline

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public including a horse racing game, a silver tea set and a 1970's miniature farmyard

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Rose Matafeo on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Amy struggles to cope after finding out about Denise and Ravi's affair and Suki is devastated when she learns Kheerat's trial has been brought forward. A smitten Ravi takes Chelsea to Nish's party and introduces her as his girlfriend

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Working with ethical hackers to hack into the fraudsters' illegal call centres, Rav Wilding uses cutting-edge technology to monitor the scammers' phone calls in an effort to stop victims losing out to real-time scams. The programme also explores the biggest anti-social issues troubling UK neighbourhoods, such as bike theft, fly-tipping and romance scams, and meets the local heroes using their own time and resources to tackle these problems head on

programme.title: Blue Lights
programme.desc: Blackthorn Street station is under an enquiry after a wild night shift racks up complaints, and Helen is forced to face the Police Ombudsman. Grace doubts her career choice after Cal is arrested for resisting a racially discriminatory Police stop and search, while Helen overhears a scandal involving her boss,that puts her and Jonty in a very precarious position, and Annie and Jen are caught up in a violent bar brawl without back up

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Charlie Brooker hosts an extended episode of the satirical quiz, with actor and comedian Miles Jupp and journalist Charlotte Ivers joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop

programme.title: Project Icon: The UK's Next Music Star
programme.desc: The latest round of the talent show puts the five remaining singers' confidence in front of camera under scrutiny. They are each challenged to produce and perform in their own original music videos. Olly Alexander from Years and Years picks the tracks they must perform, and joins the panel as a guest judge to assess the results

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: Disaster strikes at the baby shower of the year and the dogs run amok as Jake and Charlotte try to train them before the baby arrives. Letitia embarrasses her daughter in true mum fashion with stories about her love life

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: Charlotte and Jake make the finishing touches to the nursery and the final preparations are made for baby Alba's arrival and as life isn't always so rosy, Charlotte spends some time with friends to bring back some cheer before dropping some flowers off to her mum to spread the love

programme.desc: The gang prepares to celebrate Narwhal Day

programme.desc: Jay and the U15s take on fierce local rivals Bournemouth for a chance to prove themselves as potential professionals

programme.title: Odd Squad

programme.title: OOglies Funsize

programme.title: One Zoo Three
programme.desc: Cam, Tyler and Aaron explore the wildlife of Britain's coastal regions, going snorkelling with seals, trying to spot a white-tailed eagle, and revealing a seabed super-plan

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: The finishing touches are applied to a new BP garden

programme.title: Deadly Predators
programme.desc: Steve Backshall explores the world of predators, beginning with looking at how sharks use super-sensing electro reception to detect prey hidden on the bottom of the ocean

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: First-round coverage, as the tournament gets under way on day one at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring Ronnie O'Sullivan v Pang Junxu and Stuart Bingham v David Gilbert

programme.title: Live Gymnastics
programme.desc: Coverage of the fifth and penultimate day from Antalya in Turkey, as medals are decided in the apparatus finals

programme.title: Live Women's Six Nations
programme.desc: Wales v England (Kick-off 2.15pm). All the action from the opening match in the third round of fixtures, held at Cardiff Arms Park. Wales have impressed so far with victories over Ireland and Scotland, while reigning champions England are also undefeated so after comfortable wins against the Scots and Italy

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the afternoon session on day one at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring Luca Brecel v Ricky Walden and Neil Robertson v Wu Yize in the first round

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Manchester United Women v Brighton & Hove Albion Women (Kick-off 5.15pm). All the action from the FA Cup semi-final at Leigh Sports Village. Both teams are facing a top-flight opponent for the first time in this season's competition, but United will go into the match as favourites given they are also battling it out for glory in the Women's Super League, while Brighton have struggled so far this term. Whichever of these sides progress to the final will then appear in the showpiece match for the first time in club history, and will meet the winner of tomorrow's semi-final between Aston Villa Women and Chelsea Women, the latter of whom are reigning champions

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits the Vale of Mowbray pork pie factory in Northallerton, Yorkshire, where the traditional pastries have been made since 1928. Gregg finds out which cuts of pork are used and is shown how to make the hot water pastry that acts as a strong 'container' for the pork filling. Meanwhile, Cherry Healey reveals hacks for the perfect vegan short crust pastry and takes to the wheel to learn how to drive one of the HGVs transporting food products around the country every day

programme.title: Carole King and Her Songs at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of the American singer-songwriter, with a collection of performances of her songs, both by King herself and by a range of other artists, taken from BBC shows from over the decades

programme.title: Carole King: Home Again - Live in Central Park
programme.desc: The singer-songwriter's triumphant May 1973 homecoming concert on the Great Lawn of New York City's Central Park before an estimated audience of 100,000. Featured songs include It's Too Late, Home Again and You've Been Around Too Long

programme.title: Carole King: Natural Woman
programme.desc: Profile of the singer-songwriter, charting her upbringing in Brooklyn and rise to become one of the most successful musicians of her generation, credited with a string of pop hits. Featuring interviews with King herself, fellow writers Barry Mann and Cynthia Weil, her daughter Sherry Goffin Kondor, manager and producer Lou Adler, lyricists Carol Bayer Sager and Toni Stern and musicians Russ Kunkel and Danny Kortchmar

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Action from the opening day at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring first-round matches

programme.title: Snooker: World Championship Extra
programme.desc: An in-depth focus on the opening day at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, as the season-ending championship got under way with the best-of-19-frames first-round matches

programme.title: Pilgrimage
programme.desc: Continuing their travels are actresses Su Pollard and Rita Simons, Shane Lynch of Boyzone fame, reality TV star Vicky Pattison, TV personality Bobby Seagull, comedian Nabil Abdulrashid and Paralympian skier Millie Knight. The pilgrims wake up in the village of Vitorino Dos Piaes in Northern Portugal, and decide to make a quick detour to The Sanctuary of Bom Jesus do Monte

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for late spring and summer, sowing poppies and planting cornflowers for colour and interest in the Paradise Garden. Toby Buckland revels in some fabulous spring planting on a visit to the magnificent, landscaped gardens of Melbourne Hall in Derbyshire. Rachel de Thame meets a passionate dahlia grower who was once a florist working at the White House for President Obama and the First Lady

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher visits Europe's most productive leech farm in Hendy, South Wales, to learn why the creatures are making a medicinal comeback. In Swansea, Sean discovers how maggots are working their magic for a patient recovering from a major infection. Plus, medical-themed stories from the archives

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: It's a busy time in the garden, sowing and planting for the summer to come. This year's first early potatoes get started, and there's a trial of tomato plants suited to windowsill-growing. Calum Clunie checks out how the bulbs he bought from a range of supermarkets last year have developed, and Kirsty Wilson looks at the selection, care and display of houseplants

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond visits Arkverikie Estate in Inverness-shire to witness how it is adapting to climate change by plugging into renewable energy sources. Shahbaz Majeed is at Lochalsh to investigate how the arrival of electricity for the very first time in the 1940s both transformed people's lives and the landscape. Anne Lundon heads to Bonar Bridge to help serve lunch and hear how a cafe and food hub are helping the community pull together through the energy crisis, and Rosie Morton steps inside the home known as the Hobbit House and meets its creator

programme.title: Capability Brown's Unfinished Garden
programme.desc: Bunny Guinness tries to carry out the 18th-century English landscape designer's plans for his own garden in Fenstanton, Cambridgeshire. Brown travelled the length and breadth of the country, improving more than 200 of the greatest estates in the land, for some of the most influential people of the day, but the design for his own garden never got off the drawing board

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: The morning session on day two from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Stuart Bingham's v David Gilbert and the start of Ding Junui's v Hossein Vafaei, both in the first round

programme.title: Live Gymnastics
programme.desc: Live coverage of the final day from Antalya in Turkey, as medals are awarded in more apparatus finals

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day two from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Neil Robertson v Wu Yize and the start of Mark Williams v Jimmy Robertson, both in the first round. Former champions Williams and Robertson were both in dominant form at this stage last year, overcoming Michael White and Ashley Hugill respectively, and the two seeds will expect to progress once again

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams set off for checkpoint four - the remote outpost of Churchill that is only accessible by a twice-weekly train and where polar bears can outnumber people. One team make their first major mistake of the race trying to get to Calgary - they'll need to make a race-changing decision to get to the train in time. Another pair encounter a family of missionaries who make them question their reasons for running the race. And one contestant gets more than they bargained for when a bear blocks their path to the train, putting their race in jeopardy

programme.title: The Boleyns: A Scandalous Family
programme.desc: The docudrama telling the story of the rise and fall of the Boleyn family during the reign of Henry VIII concludes as Anne makes her play for the biggest prize in the kingdom. In doing so, she changes the course of British history, but the Boleyns have no idea of the high price they will have to pay

programme.title: Commando: Britain's Ocean Warriors
programme.desc: In an effort to disrupt the supply of illegal drugs to the UK, specialist commandos on a vessel in the Persian Gulf prepare to board a suspicious dhow. The programme also follows young officer Sam as he begins Arctic training in northern Norway, dealing with relentless conditions during his first time north of the Arctic Circle

programme.title: Last Woman on Earth with Sara Pascoe
programme.desc: The comedian heads to Denmark, where she learns from a Lego master builder, makes a roof out of seaweed with a group of thatchers, meets a maritime tattoo artist and finds out about sail-making

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended edition of the comedy panel game, with Nish Kumar, Mark Steel and Suzi Ruffell joining regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of thrills and spills

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: Gordon's day goes from bad to worse when he is distracted by the impulsive actions of attractive stranger Ashley, and accidentally hits a stray dog with his car. Australian comedy, starring Patrick Brammall and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Action from the evening session on day two at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield

programme.title: Snooker: World Championship Extra
programme.desc: A look back at the first-round matches on the second day of the tournament at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield

programme.title: My Life at Easter with Sally Phillips
programme.desc: Sally Philips meets the Rt Rev Rose Hudson-Wilkin to discuss what Easter means to her and how she has spent her life fighting for acceptance and change within the church

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores Britain's grasslands, from flower meadows to the rich open landscapes of our mountains and reveals some extraordinary and dramatic wildlife stories. Featuring bees that lay their eggs in empty snail shells, brown hares performing spring boxing courtship routines, and how large blue butterflies have come back from the brink of extinction

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Antiques experts Nick Hall and Tim Weeks assist the red and blue teams as they shop for bargains in Detling, Kent. Presenter Caroline Hawley monitors the contest and also visits Bekonscot, the oldest model village in the world

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Peter appears with a 1960s battery-operated tin tugboat, hoping to captivate buyers with its performance. Nicola presents a vintage petrol pump restored by her father. This 1940s piece is in great condition and she uses this virtue to drive a hard bargain with the five dealers. Raj offers up a set of stylish and functional stools, while Rachel showcases two charming funfair dolphins. Nigel Havers hosts

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef witnesses a fishing method frozen in time, where the use of engines and winches is banned, and goes fishing under sail for what he considers to be the best oysters in the world. Back on dry land, Rick cooks a warming fish soup called Cullen Skink, and discovers the all-but-forgotten story of Cornwall's ancient capital, Lostwithiel

programme.title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast
programme.desc: Derek Brockway's walk in Cardigan Bay has something for everyone. For the first half he's at one with nature as he explores one of Britain's largest and oldest raised peat bogs. His route then takes him to a unique railway museum, filled with nostalgia and he also discovers the legend of Cantre Gwaelod at Sarn Cynfelyn where the shingle spit stretches an incredible 11kms out to sea. He finishes at the university town of Aberystwyth with its Victorian cliff-top pleasure park, complete with camera obscura. Derek also has a go at paddle-boarding - which has its challenges

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Nicky takes calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the morning session on day three from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Ding Junhui v Hossein Vafaei and the start of Mark Allen v Fan Zhengyi, both in the first round

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day three from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Mark Williams v Jimmy Robertson and the start of John Higgins v David Grace in the first round. Williams and Higgins have won this title on seven occasions between them and it would be of little surprise should either of the players go far in this year's tournament

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ruby Bhogal, Ed Byrne, Ingrid Oliver and Matthew Pinsent test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week with a winner declared on Friday

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Shirley Ballas is the next well-known face to check in to the Victorian villa nestled on the wild coast of Northern Ireland, where host Sharon and her team ensure that all guests come away from the 19th-century B&B with new skills and a fresh perspective. The Strictly Come Dancing judge is kept on her toes by the team and from pig farming to pottery, takes it all in her stride

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara Cox is joined by TV presenters Laura Whitmore and Gethin Jones, actress Meera Syal and actor Joe Thomas, who champion their favourite books. The guests also review this week's two book club choices, which are Old God's Time by Sebastian Barry, and My Family And Other Animals by Gerald Durrell

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: Crews race to rescue a shark attack victim and two boys who have been swept far out to sea

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts the sixth and concluding semi-final of the quiz, with four returning contenders answering questions on the specialist subjects of Edwin Lutyens, Coldplay, the Karen Pirie novels of Val McDermid, and the films of Terry Gilliam, before they are each tested on general knowledge

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The quarter-final stage continues, with two teams who lost their first match returning to try to secure the win they need to stay in the competition, with the losing one being eliminated. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary charting the last five years of the life of cancer campaigner Deborah James, a former deputy head teacher who amassed a huge social media following through her online persona Bowelbabe. She talks frankly about her diagnosis with bowel cancer and the treatment she received, revealing what the reality of living with bowel cancer was like for her and those closest to her. The film features mobile-phone footage, Deborah's collection of Tik Tok videos, Instagram posts, You Me and the Big C podcasts, family videos and Deborah's voice notes

programme.title: Live at the Apollo Bites
programme.desc: Highlights from 15th series of the stand-up showcase, with the first edition featured comedians Kiri Pritchard-McLean, Stephen Bailey and Desiree Burch

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Faisal Islam

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Action from day three at Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring more first-round matches

programme.title: Snooker: World Championship Extra
programme.desc: Extended highlights of one of today's first-round matches from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher visits Europe's most productive leech farm in Hendy, South Wales, to learn why the creatures are making a medicinal comeback. In Swansea, Sean discovers how maggots are working their magic for a patient recovering from a major infection. Plus, medical-themed stories from the archives

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: A child-friendly sunscreen applicator and a hard-water shower filter are demonstrated, and a collectable whisky company offers an interesting guarantee to self-made millionaires Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Reunion Hotel
programme.desc: Alex Jones gives people a chance to be reunited with someone pivotal from their past, beginning with 21-year-old Tegan, whose life was saved by a stranger after she fell onto a Tube track. Cameras also follow Lee, who hopes to meet his brother for the first time, and Pippa, a youngster who wants to thank volunteers for a life-changing home improvement which helped ease her rare skin condition

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day one at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring more first-round action, with Ronnie O'Sullivan set to conclude his match against Pang Junxu and Ali Carter beginning his versus Jak Jones. O'Sullivan got his tournament under way 12 months ago with a 10-5 victory over David Gilbert and went on to prevail 19-13 over Judd Trump in the final to become the oldest world champion in the sport's history at the age of 46 years and 148 days

programme.title: Lost: Those Who Kill
programme.desc: The police hunt for Bjorn is intensified. Following a search of Pelle's home, Frederik and Louise uncover truths about Bjorn's past and a decision is reached on the forced removal of Maria's child. In Danish

programme.title: Lost: Those Who Kill
programme.desc: Another crime is committed and Frederik is convinced Bjorn is the perpetrator, but Louise's investigations point to a different suspect. Louise learns a secret that might close the case. In Danish

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc: Parodies of pre-war tales of heroism and derring-do, written by and starring Michael Palin and Terry Jones. A pupil at a public school is downtrodden one moment and official bully-in-residence the next, enjoying bizarre privileges including opium-smoking and the amorous attentions of Filipino women. From 1976

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc: The tragic tale of Eric Olthwaite, the world's most boring man, who unexpectedly turns his life around by joining forces with a hardened criminal and embarking on a wild life of villainy and intrigue. Comedy, written by star Michael Palin alongside Terry Jones, with Liz Smith and Kenneth Colley. From 1977

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel becomes depressed that his abilities are dwindling as he ages, while Jean meets his active, outgoing and eccentric father Rocky for the first time - and finds him surprisingly endearing. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Terry arrives home to find his parents on holiday, the fridge empty, the house cold and Thelma her usual unhelpful self. Luckily Bob is on hand with a suggestion. Comedy, starring James Bolam and Rodney Bewes, with Brigit Forsyth

programme.title: Restoring the Earth: The Age of Nature
programme.desc: The documentary considers how people's understanding of nature is increasing in order to manage global warming, which is changing the planet faster than ever before

programme.title: The Secret Life of Waves
programme.desc: David Malone investigates the importance of ocean waves. He discovers they are not made of water, can travel sideways and their sound is created by bubbles, and examines the connection between the life cycles of waves and human beings

programme.title: The Classical Collection
programme.desc: A selection of performances of the music of Bach from the BBC archives featuring soloists including David Oistrakh, Yo-Yo Ma, Andras Schiff and Myra Hess

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day two at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Ali Carter v Jak Jones and Luca Brecel v Ricky Walden in round one. Carter is a two-time runner-up, but has not gone beyond this stage since 2019 and failed to qualify for the main draw last year, while Brecel was defeated by Noppon Saengkham at this stage of the 2022 tournament

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: John Eliot Gardiner conducts the Monteverdi Choir and the English Baroque Soloists in a performance of Johann Sebastian Bach's celebrated composition St John Passion, from 2008, with Mark Padmore as the Evangelist and Peter Harvey as Christus. Petroc Trelawny presents

programme.title: Mozart Requiem and Mass in C Minor
programme.desc: Performance of the classical pieces from El Palau de la Musica in Barcelona, first broadcast more than 10 years ago to mark the anniversary of Mozart's death. John Eliot Gardiner conducts stars, including Barbara Bonney, Anne-Sofie Von Otter and Alastair Miles, who are accompanied by the Monteverdi Choir and the English Baroque Soloists

programme.title: The Art Mysteries with Waldemar Januszczak
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak examines Gauguin's Vision After the Sermon,an epic 17th-century religious painting exploring temptation and desire. He uncovers some unusual connections with sumo wrestling, Victor Hugo's Les Miserables, and a 17-year-old girl called Madeleine

programme.title: Mozart Requiem and Mass in C Minor
programme.desc: Performance of the classical pieces from El Palau de la Musica in Barcelona, first broadcast more than 10 years ago to mark the anniversary of Mozart's death. John Eliot Gardiner conducts stars, including Barbara Bonney, Anne-Sofie Von Otter and Alastair Miles, who are accompanied by the Monteverdi Choir and the English Baroque Soloists

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day three at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the start of Robert Milkins v Joe Perry and the conclusion of Mark Allen v Fan Zhengyi in the first round. Allen set up a plum tie against eventual champion Ronnie O'Sullivan at this stage last year with a 10-6 victory over Scott Donaldson, and will hope to progress further this time around having won the Northern Ireland Open, UK Championship and World Grand Prix since then

programme.title: Treasures of the Anglo-Saxons
programme.desc: Historian Dr Janina Ramirez investigates the development of Anglo-Saxon art. Examining the Sutton Hoo treasures the Franks Casket, the Staffordshire Hoard and the Lindisfarne Gospels, she uncovers the secret codes and symbols that reveal the pagan past and Christian future of the Anglo-Saxon people, and discusses how their artistic development was brought to an end by the Norman invasion of 1066

programme.title: Endgame in Ireland
programme.desc: Former US president Bill Clinton talks for the first time about his decision to go against the advice of his State Department and grant Gerry Adams a visa, a move which kick-started the peace process. However, the Docklands bombing in 1996 _ followed by the explosion in Manchester four months later _ signalled the end of the ceasefire and saw Sinn Fein banned from the all-party talks

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc: Work on the derelict miller's cottage appears to be progressing, but Griff Rhys Jones meets opposition from the locals over his plans to renovate the mill. Plus, the comedian takes on another unusual restoration project

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Mathematician Hannah Fry is joined by a selection of BBC science experts to investigate the British public's questions about the future, trying to discover whether people could live for ever and if there will be a cure for cancer. Hannah examines the future of transport and if it will be possible to ditch fossil fuels, looks at what the weather will be like and discovers if the planet is on the verge of another mass extinction

programme.title: Own the Sky: Jet Pack Dreamers
programme.desc: The story of Australian David Mayman, whose passion for the tantalising possibilities of jetpacks became an obsession. Filmed over 10 years, the documentary follows his seemingly impossible quest to realise his childhood dream to build and fly the world's first jetpack - an ambition that almost cost him his life

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: John Eliot Gardiner conducts the Monteverdi Choir and the English Baroque Soloists in a performance of Johann Sebastian Bach's celebrated composition St John Passion, from 2008, with Mark Padmore as the Evangelist and Peter Harvey as Christus. Petroc Trelawny presents

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep

programme.desc: The OZT brothers are on an adventure to take a closer look at some of Britain's threatened grassland animals. Aaron and Cam go off-road in a bumpy dash across the wilds of Exmoor to try and gather more than 100 semi-wild ponies off the moor for their annual health check. Cam meets 12-year-old wildlife hero and butterfly champion Rebecca to find out why she is so fascinated with butterflies. Meanwhile, Tyler heads to the Forest of Dean to team up with the snake whisperer, on a mission to track down an adder, one of our most secretive and threatened snakes. In the heart of mid Wales, Aaron meets a wildlife hero who has played a big part in the recent success story of the red kite, and he is blown away when hundreds of red kites fill the sky. Back at OZT HQ, Cam gets his hands on the latest wildlife filming kit to give us the low-down on how the incredible shots of high-jumping hares were filmed in Sir David Attenboroughs Wild Isles series. programme.desc: Pirate doll Freeda is the latest addition to Geppetto's Shop of Wonders but soon disappears! Freeda must find her stolen maps before she settles into her new home. Will Pinocchio be able to help her find the maps before Fox and Cat get to them?

programme.title: Molly and Mack
programme.desc: Molly examines her shelf of special things at the back of Macks stall. She chooses the little toy donkey and remembers the day she got it. Molly and Mack are visiting Daisy at the vet's when she gets a call from Mrs Anderson. Daisy seems a little stressed by this, so Molly and Mack decide to follow her to the farm to find out whats going on. At the Kids Club, Moira finds Lennoxs jokes hilarious, but unfortunately not Jamess. James takes this on as a challenge - he must make Moira laugh. Back at the farm, Mrs Anderson tells Daisy about Thistle, her donkey, who has something stuck in her hoof. Hiding nearby, Molly and Mack watch, confused at how nervous Daisy is with Thistle. Her subsequent sneezing fit leaves Molly and Mack even more mystified. Jamess finest puns are having no effect on Moira. Mack tries to get Daisy to talk about whats going on. Molly soon realises what could be wrong with Daisy, and she decides they need to do some research. At the Wobbly Coffee Pot cafe, James

programme.title: Reunion Hotel
programme.desc: The Fabs were the first all-female group from Wales, brought together inspired by the success of the Beatles. Breaking through in a male-dominated industry was difficult in the 1960s, but Swedish boy band Moonlighters recognised their talents and left a big impression on the girls. Now more than five decades later, members of both bands enjoy a much-anticipated reunion. Plus, ex-addict Simon meets the man who turned his life around and Ellie thanks a teacher who was her rock following a terror attack. Presented by Alex Jones

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The team helps launch the Wild Britain campaign to protect the UK's wildlife. Ellie Harrison and Hamza Yassin join volunteers transforming an old playing field on the Lincolnshire Fens into a wildlife haven. John Craven heads to Chester Zoo, and Tom Heap looks at the UK's track record for protecting nature, and if a new bill currently going through parliament could undermine it. With special appearances from nature lovers Judi Dench and Deborah Meaden

programme.title: Our Changing Planet
programme.desc: Part one of two. The second year of a seven-year project to save the planet's endangered ecosystems. Chris Packham is in Greenland to learn more about the rate at which snow and ice are melting and retreating in the Arctic. Liz Bonnin returns to California to investigate surprising solutions for the state's wildfire season, and Steve Backshall travels to the Maldives, a country facing significant challenges because of climate change

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the grounds of Aston Hall in Birmingham, joined by Benjamin Zephaniah, who shares his passion for unusual banknotes and currency - including a gold medal honouring Ethiopian Emperor Haile Selassie. Items brought in to be valued include a collection of football memorabilia, artwork and mountaineering equipment, and wooden figures depicting characters from The Wind in the Willows

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: London life begins to take its toll on Pip, who hits the bottle in a bid to cope - a lifestyle that leads to a drunken altercation with a French corsair, who is the latest target for Jaggers' schemes. His work for the brutish Mr Drummle, under instruction from Jaggers, leads to a shocking reunion with Estella, where he is forced to act as chaperone with her and her fiance

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring West Ham United v Arsenal at London Stadium and Nottingham Forest v Manchester United at the City Ground. The Gunners were unbeaten in their last seven meetings with West Ham and will have expected to extend that run and boost their title hopes. United were looking for a fourth win of the season over Forest, having won the reverse fixture 3-0 and also prevailed home and away in the semi-finals of the Carabao Cup. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: Paul Murton explores the River Teviot in the Scottish Borders, once the haunt of notorious Border Reivers. In the town of Hawick, Paul joins the annual Common Riding. He also joins a paranormal researcher in an attempt to contact ghosts in Jedburgh's old jail before heading to the river's confluence with the Tweed - where a king went off with a bang

programme.title: Blue Lights
programme.desc: Blackthorn Street station is under an enquiry after a wild night shift racks up complaints, and Helen is forced to face the Police Ombudsman. programme.title: Facelift
programme.desc: Darren McKeown and Tom Cronin visiting Beverly Hills facial plastic surgeon Dr Ben Talei for advice on the running of their new hospital, before they welcome the arrival of their baby girl Ophelia. After enjoying their newfound family bubble, tensions rise as Ophelia develops an infection

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Jane Lewis presents action from the latest fixtures in the women's top flight, including Partick Thistle v Rangers and Glasgow City v Celtic

programme.title: Nadiya's Everyday Baking
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain creates some easy celebration bakes, including a glittering meringue layer cake, a slow-cooked lamb curry fit for a feast, a traditional Eastern European sweet bread known as babka and an American inspired seafood extravaganza. She also meets award-winning macaron maker Naeem Mohamed, who shares his astonishing macaron stack cake

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott looks ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including West Ham United v Arsenal. Plus, news from the lunchtime game between Aston Villa and Newcastle United

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day one at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring Luca Brecel v Ricky Walden and Neil Robertson v Wu Yize in the first round. Brecel has never progressed beyond the first round, while Robertson was a champion in 2010

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of this afternoon's results from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Dr Hilary Jones, TV presenter Danni Menzies, drag queen Kitty Scott-Claus and actor Niamh McGrady are in the famous black chair, answering Clive Myrie's questions on the discovery of penicillin, rally driver Rosemary Smith, Girls Aloud, and Bluey

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts as daytime TV stars Fern Britton, Owain Wyn Evans, Naga Munchetty, Charlie Stayt, Mr Motivator, Carol McGiffin, Diarmuid Gavin and Dr Punam Krishan try to win 50,000 for charity

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a revival of the comedy quiz show, in which a panel of six celebrities fill in the blanks to help contestants win some brilliant prizes. With Adjoa Andoh, Martine McCutcheon, Johnny Vegas, Jimmy Carr, Chizzy Akudolu and Joe Swash

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Mari Wilson, Jaki Graham, Ruthie Henshall, Kerry Ellis, Carrie Grant, David Grant, Nicola Stephenson and Charlie Condou try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public to win a prize for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jan is shocked to recognise a drunk and homeless patient suffering from trench foot as her ex-husband, and discovers to her horror that she is still listed as his next of kin. Max issues a challenge - whichever new nurse has the most impressive shift will win a prize - and Dylan accidentally makes Donna's life much harder when she comes to the aid of a patient collapsed in the car park

programme.title: Magpie Murders
programme.desc: Susan finds herself under pressure to make decisions about her future, as CityWorld need to know if she wants to be CEO but Andreas wants to go back to Crete. She is still determined to find the missing last chapter of Alan Conway's book, and her suspicions are further aroused about his untimely end

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Aston Villa v Newcastle United at Villa Park and Manchester City v Leicester City. United continued their bid for a top-four place away to the mid-table Villans, while the Citizens will have expected three points to aid their title-challenge when they entertained struggling Leicester

programme.title: Match of the Day Top 10
programme.desc: Gary Lineker, Micah Richards and Alan Shearer present a countdown of some of the many fine French players to have graced the Premier League

programme.title: The Place Beyond the Pines (2012)
programme.desc: A motorcycle stunt rider is reunited with his lost love and the son he has never met. He gives up his life on the road to support them, but ends up drawn into crime, attracting the attention of a troubled, ambitious cop and setting in motion a conflict that will have unforeseen consequences for both men's children. Crime drama, starring Ryan Gosling and Bradley Cooper

programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt hosts a special live edition of the cookery show in celebration of Eid al-Fitr. Special guests DJ and producer Naughty Boy, model Mariah Idrissi and actor and presenter Islah Abdur-Rahman will be sharing their favourite Eid traditions and there will be recipes for dishes to cook for the festival and to break the fast in the last week of Ramadan, courtesy of Mursal Saiq, Dr Saliha Mahmood Ahmed and Fozia Ismail

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin, Martel Maxwell and Martin Roberts look around properties in Blackpool, Derby and the West Midlands town of Bilston, before hearing how they have been redeveloped

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Aled Jones visits Bournville to explore the faith and philanthropy of the Cadbury family, whose Quaker beliefs guided the creation of their revolutionary factory village. Plus, James Lusted meets David Stretton-Downes, a Christian entrepreneur and creator of a start-up founded with the vision to help elevate children out of poverty

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Aston Villa Women v Chelsea Women (Kick-off 2.15pm). All the action from the FA Cup semi-final at Poundland Bescot Stadium. Chelsea are the holders of this competition, having beaten Manchester City 3-2 in last season's final, but the Villans will take confidence from their 2-1 win after extra time against last term's runners-up in the quarter-finals

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough introduces the colourful underwater world of Britain and Ireland's oceans, including thousands of grey seals congregating on the Norfolk shoreline to give birth. Rich beds of sea grass act as important carbon storage areas, as well as providing home for seahorses, while on the shallow seabed, the spider crab undergoes a mass migration of epic scale

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The team helps launch the Wild Britain campaign to protect the UK's wildlife. Ellie Harrison and Hamza Yassin join volunteers transforming an old playing field on the Lincolnshire Fens into a wildlife haven. John Craven heads to Chester Zoo, and Tom Heap looks at the UK's track record for protecting nature, and if a new bill currently going through parliament could undermine it. With special appearances from nature lovers Judi Dench and Deborah Meaden

programme.title: Our Changing Planet
programme.desc: Part one of two. The second year of a seven-year project to save the planet's endangered ecosystems. Chris Packham is in Greenland to learn more about the rate at which snow and ice are melting and retreating in the Arctic. Liz Bonnin returns to California to investigate surprising solutions for the state's wildfire season, and Steve Backshall travels to the Maldives, a country facing significant challenges because of climate change

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the grounds of Aston Hall in Birmingham, joined by Benjamin Zephaniah, who shares his passion for unusual banknotes and currency - including a gold medal honouring Ethiopian Emperor Haile Selassie. Items brought in to be valued include a collection of football memorabilia, artwork and mountaineering equipment, and wooden figures depicting characters from The Wind in the Willows

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: London life begins to take its toll on Pip, who hits the bottle in a bid to cope - a lifestyle that leads to a drunken altercation with a French corsair, who is the latest target for Jaggers' schemes. His work for the brutish Mr Drummle, under instruction from Jaggers, leads to a shocking reunion with Estella, where he is forced to act as chaperone with her and her fiance

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring West Ham United v Arsenal at London Stadium and Nottingham Forest v Manchester United at the City Ground. The Gunners were unbeaten in their last seven meetings with West Ham and will have expected to extend that run and boost their title hopes. United were looking for a fourth win of the season over Forest, having won the reverse fixture 3-0 and also prevailed home and away in the semi-finals of the Carabao Cup. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Queen & Slim (2019)
programme.desc: A black couple's first date takes a shocking turn when a traffic stop leads to the killing of the police officer in self-defence, and the fugitive pair hit the road for a life-changing journey. Crime drama, starring Daniel Kaluuya, Jodie Turner-Smith and Bokeem Woodbine

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies

programme.desc: A businessman and his personal assistant decide to mark Halley's comet's latest orbit past Earth by flying their exclusive flying yacht beyond the atmosphere to chase it. Suddenly, the Lady Bone Demon's minion the Mayor steals the lantern...

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid

programme.desc: Brian, Pat and Connor take part in a shopping showdown in Leeds in the hope of winning a blind date with professional dancer Leah

programme.title: Chuck
programme.desc: Chuck meets an agent who is wanted on suspicion of murder, but finds himself in a dilemma when he has to decide whether to turn the man over to Sarah and Casey or help him escape the agency's control. Guest starring Jonathan Sadowski ($#*! My Dad Says)

programme.title: One Tree Hill
programme.desc: Lucas confronts Derek about his interest in Peyton and receives threats as a result. Rachel sets Brooke up on a blind date with an older man as the story of her pregnancy spreads. Meanwhile, Haley thinks she is losing Nathan after he gains a scholarship offer from Duke University

programme.title: The O.C.
programme.desc: Ryan leaves Newport to visit his mother, and ends up having a steamy encounter with her co-worker. Summer works with Taylor to find out what Seth is hiding, while Julie visits Volchok to give him stern advice

programme.title: Secret Crush
programme.desc: The lovelorn singletons revealing all include Danielle, who is hoping to prove she is more than just a side-dish to ladies-man Alexi, while wannabe WAG Brooke hopes sparks will fly with Shaun. Verona Rose presents

programme.title: Dress to Impress
programme.desc: Brian, Pat and Connor take part in a shopping showdown in Leeds in the hope of winning a blind date with professional dancer Leah

programme.title: Supermarket Sweep
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal hosts a revival of the supermarket-based game show in which three pairs of shoppers go wild in the aisles to win a 3,000 prize

programme.title: Chuck
programme.desc: The spy returns to his alma mater Stanford - the university that expelled him - to help his old professor, who is also a government agent in possession of a secret file. While trying to protect him, Chuck learns a few things about himself, as well as further information about Bryce Larkin's death. Action comedy, starring Zachary Levi

programme.title: One Tree Hill
programme.desc: Nathan wrestles with financial difficulties before reluctantly asking Dan for help. Brooke discovers her new love is also her English teacher, while Peyton receives help from an unexpected source. Lucas returns to the Ravens in time to help the team progress in the play-offs for the state championship. Guest starring former basketball player Rick Fox

programme.title: The O.C.
programme.desc: As graduation approaches, the friends leave Newport to attend their respective college open days at Berkeley and Brown. While dropping the boys off at the airport, Kirsten is surprised to see Theresa holding a familiar baby boy. Sparks fly when Seth bumps into Anna at university

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity edition of the game show, asking contestants Richard Osman, Gregg Wallace and Penny Lancaster to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara host as more contenders take on the obstacle course as the knockout competition to find male and female champions continues. Hopefuls must not only face each other, but also have to face the Elite Ninjas - a team of professional athletes determined to beat them in head-to-head races

programme.title: Bob's Burgers
programme.desc: Bob is determined to do whatever it takes to cook a rare heritage turkey after the gas goes out on Thanksgiving

programme.title: Bob's Burgers
programme.desc: Gene auditions for a role in a local theatre production, but learns Linda interfered

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois and Peter are mistaken for young parents by another couple at Stewie's school and are invited to live in an apartment complex for millennials, leaving Meg and Chris home alone

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg gets a place at Brown University, but she is suspended for her application being fraudulent and has to prove she deserves to be there. Meanwhile, Brian tries to get fit

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: A DIY mishap leads to a stray cat wandering into the house and Meg becomes attached to it quickly, while Brian tries to convince her that the furry feline is evil

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter gets a job as a nurse after making it through the whole of flu season without getting sick, but is torn when enemy the Giant Chicken is admitted. Brian has an identity crisis

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian finds himself bonding with his new girlfriend's son, while Peter, Quagmire and Cleveland go joyriding in Joe's new car

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan tries to show Hayley that he can still provide relevant advice by resolving to improve the life of a stripper. However, his hopes of proving his headstrong daughter wrong are dashed when his circumstances change for the worse, and he ends up dancing for cash at his own strip club

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan is asked to persuade the dictator of Isla Island to sign a treaty to secure a promotion at work. However, he ends up accidentally killing the man, and enlists Roger to take his place

programme.title: Bob's Burgers
programme.desc: Linda works a temp job at the post office to make extra money for the holidays.

programme.title: Bob's Burgers
programme.desc: Gene gets kicked out of Ocean Avenue Hi-fi Emporium, but Louise takes matters into her own hands

programme.title: Don't Hate the Playaz
programme.desc: Maya Jama, Keisha Buchanan and London Hughes go up against Lady Leshurr, Cariad Lloyd and Mist as they go head to head in rap battles, dance-offs and freestyling challenges. Jordan Stephens hosts, with help from DJ Shortee Blitz on the decks

programme.title: Totally Bonkers Guinness World Records
programme.desc: Matt Edmondson introduces the records for putting on hair rollers while on a rollercoaster and regurgitating coins, and sees the world's biggest collection of Star Wars memorabilia

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Martin Clunes: My Travels and Other Animals
programme.desc: The actor learns how to look after vulnerable creatures as he travels the world. Martin heads to the Ningaloo reef in Australia and swims with the world's biggest fish, the whale shark, before taking part in the oldest Royal tradition - swan upping - on the River Thames

programme.title: Martin Clunes: My Travels and Other Animals
programme.desc: The actor explores horses in history, travelling high into the Pyrenees mountains, where there is a record of the horse drawn on the walls of the Niaux Cave from 14,000 years ago. A hundred years ago, fishermen used horses to trawl the sea for shrimps, and Martin spends a day fishing with these last European horse fishermen. And in Dubai he visits the Meydan racecourse, the one place that still connects us with our equine past

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: The detective is paired with DC Webster, an officer who is struggling to fit in with life in Denton after being seconded from Scotland, with the duo investigating a robbery at a local casino and a hit-and-run incident involving Roger Massie, the son of a local politician, and soon finds that both matters are linked. David Jason stars, with Bruce Alexander and George Anton

programme.title: Carry On Again Doctor (1969)
programme.desc: A disgraced surgeon sets up a clinic in the hope of promoting a supposedly miraculous slimming potion made from secret ingredients discovered on a remote tropical island. Comedy, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Jim Dale, Barbara Windsor, Charles Hawtrey, Hattie Jacques, Pat Coombs and Joan Sims

programme.title: Carry On Up the Jungle (1970)
programme.desc: A Victorian explorer recalls how he was recruited by an aristocrat to find her missing son in the African jungle. Teaming up with a fearless hunter, he hoped to find a rare bird on his journey - but instead fell into the clutches of an all-female tribe. Comedy, starring Sid James, Frankie Howerd, Joan Sims, Kenneth Connor, Charles Hawtrey and Terry Scott

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate the deaths of a female pensioner and a vicar who were both killed during Broughton village's annual contest between men and women. The pair soon discover the preacher had a secret that could provide a motive - but when another body is found, they realise the answer to all the deaths lies in the history books. John Nettles and Jason Hughes star

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the body of a young man is found in a Second World War-era motor car full of exhaust fumes, it looks like an obvious case of suicide. But Simon Bright was not alone - and he was hit on the head before he died. Where is his girlfriend, newcomer Laura Sharp? And what is her hold on the people of Morton Fendle, a village still overshadowed by the gloomy spectre of the war? John Nettles and Jason Hughes star

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A mischievous trickster finally gets his comeuppance when his body is found floating below the weir in Midsomer Deverell. The extent of his double life starts to emerge when three family friends and a long-lost niece produce wills claiming his fortune, and his collection of erotic photographs from the 1960s gives Barnaby and Jones the key to the tangled relationships and feuds blighting the family

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a family glassware business collapses following the death of one of its partners, Barnaby investigates allegations of financial irregularities, love triangles and a string of murders. Lapsed Freemason Jones uses his inside knowledge to explore the ceremonial aspects of two killings, but it is Cully's production of Hamlet that gives Tom the key to the mystery. John Nettles, Jason Hughes, Jane Wymark and Laura Howard star

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A depressive gambler is found dead, the apparent victim of suicide. Dr Jane Moore, who once treated the man, is adamant he wouldn't have taken his own life - a theory backed up by the post-mortem. Thrilled to be working with Jane again, Barnaby investigates the case - and it isn't long before another of the doctor's patients is killed. Detective drama, starring John Nettles, Isla Blair, Jan Ravens and Daniel Casey

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An aristocrat's wealthy, overbearing wife finances a North African archaeological dig to find the skull of John the Baptist. Poirot is in attendance, but when the woman is found stabbed to death, and only her husband, the exuberant Lord Boynton, appears distraught, the detective struggles to identify the killer among the wealth of suspects. Guest starring Tim Curry, Cheryl Campbell, John Hannah, Emma Cunniffe, Mark Gatiss, Angela Pleasence and Beth Goddard, with David Suchet in the title role

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: The duo look into the murder of an eight-year-old boy, coming up against a paedophile who cruelly deceives his victim's family. Dom's HIV test comes back negative, so he sets out to celebrate - only to endanger his own life and jeopardise Rachel's sergeant's exam in the process. Janet tells Andy she is having second thoughts about their brief liaison, but he finds her decision hard to accept. Suranne Jones and Lesley Sharp star, with Liam Boyle, Nicholas Gleaves and Joe Duttine

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Bless This House
programme.desc: Jean's sister visits, but she is not included in Sid's pre-arranged plans - and he is not about to alter them. Comedy, starring Sid James

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Jack tackles what promises to be the most sensitive and unenviable investigation of his entire career - deciding whether a man with Down's syndrome is capable of committing murder. David Jason stars as the caustic copper, with Bruce Alexander and Matthew Marsh

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A confrontation between hunt stewards and saboteurs leads to the suspicious death of a protester - and makes Jack wonder whether the thrill of the chase has given the horsey set a taste for human blood. Whodunit, starring David Jason as DI Frost, with Bruce Alexander, Sean Pertwee, Del Henney and Tat Whalley

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Al tries to raise some quick cash, and offers to sort out all Louisa's household and plumbing problems if she can pay him promptly. The teacher gets good news on the employment front, and Martin accidentally inflicts a minor wound on an elderly patient - who responds by walking out of the surgery and vowing never to return. Drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz, with Phyllida Law and Benjamin Whitrow

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Plans for Robert's birthday party are under way, but Rose's surprise contribution to the event ruffles feathers above and below stairs. Mary faces dramatic repercussions when a new farming venture is launched on the Downton estate, while Edith receives more unwelcome news. Hugh Bonneville, Lily James, Michelle Dockery and Laura Carmichael star in the costume drama

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Cora's playboy brother Harold has got himself into a spot of bother and Robert has to make a trip to America to bail him out. Blake and Mary are forced to put aside their differences to deal with the new farming venture on the estate, and help comes from an unlikely quarter when Violet is taken ill. Meanwhile, Mrs Hughes, Mrs Patmore and Carson try to keep the peace when romantic tensions cause disagreements downstairs. Hugh Bonneville, Julian Ovenden, Michelle Dockery and Maggie Smith star in the costume drama

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Rosamund comes up with a plan to help Edith out of her predicament, but will Violet see straight through it? Rose is frustrated when things don't go her way and Alfred realises too late he may have made a mistake. Anna is concerned by unexpected news just as she and Bates seem to be getting over the worst, Isobel finds herself the object of someone's attention and Mary asks Gillingham for a favour

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: It's summer and as part of Rose's debutante 'coming out' she is to be presented at Buckingham Palace. The family is in London, preparing Grantham House for the busy social programme, and Martha Levinson, not one to miss such a grand occasion, arrives from New York with Cora's recently disgraced brother Harold (Sideways star Paul Giamatti). Both outspoken and larger than life, they make quite an impression on certain members of high society. Meanwhile, when the Crawleys are implicated in a scandal that threatens to engulf the monarchy, Robert goes to great lengths to protect the royal family - and his own. Costume drama, starring Lily James, Shirley MacLaine, Hugh Bonneville, Maggie Smith, Laura Carmichael and Elizabeth McGovern

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: While Britain feels the winds of change swept in by a new Labour government in 1924, Downton's residents - both above and below stairs - are undergoing alterations too. After mourning the death of his beloved wife Lady Sybil for four years, Branson decides it's time he got on with his life, although Robert isn't comfortable about the ex-chauffeur's relationship with local teacher Sarah Bunting. Mary is also ready for love again - but which of her beaus is her Mr Right? Meanwhile, Edith struggles to cope with being parted from her baby, Jimmy receives unwanted female attention and plans for a war memorial cause tension

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detectives investigate two murders in which the victims have been placed in water and surrounded by flowers. Vera and sidekick Joe believe the culprit may be linked to a group of bird-watching friends, but despite their increasingly tangled and dysfunctional relationships, the twitchers seem determined to protect one another. The very first episode of the drama adapted from Ann Cleeves' novel Hidden Depths, starring Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Gina McKee, Wunmi Mosaku, Paul Ritter and Neil Armstrong

programme.title: Inside the Ritz Hotel
programme.desc: Documentary offering a behind the scenes look at life inside the Ritz Hotel in London, one of the most famous, traditional luxury hotels in the world. The programmes follows some of the famous faces that visit the hotels, including Richard E Grant, Anna Wintour and Mo Salah, and the work of hotel staff as they prepare for their famous afternoon tea. With consumers spending less and ever more luxury hotels opening their doors, how does one of the most well-known hotels in the world stand out from the rest?

programme.title: Inside the Ritz Hotel
programme.desc: Executive chef John Williams prepares to launch the first-ever cookbook that reveals The Ritz's most famous recipes. Penny Lancaster pops in for cocktails, and head concierge Michael De Cozar is celebrated for his 46 years of service

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: A dark family secret comes to light when a female hit-and-run suspect claims the woman she deliberately ran over on a pedestrian crossing was a ghost. However, the facts of the case tell a different story. Gwen Taylor guest stars, with Jack Shepherd

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The discovery of a local landowner's body throws suspicion on two of his tenants, a couple who have previously been threatened with violence for refusing to move out of their cottage. Rather than stay and face the music they disappear, and Wycliffe realises if he does not get to them before the victim's family, the consequences could be deadly. Drama, starring Jack Shepherd and Jimmy Yuill

programme.title: Ladies of Letters
programme.desc: Vera and Irene make themselves at home on the prison ship, but a tattoo around Vera's navel leads to blood poisoning and Irene is shocked to learn her granddaughter has been told her granny is dead. Comedy, based on the books and radio series by Carole Hayman and Lou Wakefield, starring Maureen Lipman and Anne Reid

programme.title: Ladies of Letters
programme.desc: Vera campaigns to get Irene freed from the prison ship, aware that her pen pal is quite at home running a literacy programme and planning a production of Les Mis. The fundraiser goes well, though snooker player Les Spatchcock proves a poor substitute celebrity for Posh and Becks. Comedy, starring Maureen Lipman and Anne Reid

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: On the eve of an important dinner party, Mrs Bridges breaks down and steals a baby. Period drama, staring Angela Baddely and Gordon Jackson

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Janet comes face to face with the man who left her fighting for life just months earlier - serial killer Geoff Hastings, who has vowed to finally reveal the full extent of his crimes. Rachel and the rest of the team investigate the racially motivated murder of a taxi driver. On the personal front, Andy refuses to take no for an answer, so Janet threatens to report him to the DCI. Crime drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones, with an appearance by Kevin Doyle (Downton Abbey's Molesley)

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A confrontation between hunt stewards and saboteurs leads to the suspicious death of a protester - and makes Jack wonder whether the thrill of the chase has given the horsey set a taste for human blood. Whodunit, starring David Jason as DI Frost, with Bruce Alexander, Sean Pertwee, Del Henney and Tat Whalley

programme.title: Bless This House
programme.desc: The Abbotts catch flu and Sid is forced to act as nursemaid. Sitcom, starring Sid James

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity heads for the Dingles' to continue where she left off, but Cain ruins everything with a jibe about her past. Zoe feels foolish about attending rape counselling

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Zoe visits Yolanda at work, but doesn't believe a word the dancer says about Scott. At the hospital, Chris refuses to come clean about his health

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Richard receives grim news, Ken tries to persuade Mike to give Ade work experience, and Dev tells Geena he wants proof that she has carried out his demands

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Richard struggles to contain his fear as the police ask him to formally identify Patricia's body. Peter pays a certain blonde florist a visit

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Simon and Oliver agree to undertake a stock check, but deceit and greed are the order of the day. Comedy, starring Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Simon and Oliver's strained partnership reaches crisis point as their alliance threatens their profit margins. Comedy, starring Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Skelthwaite is buzzing on Luke and Megan's wedding day, but there's more in store for the guests than many anticipated. Billy shares an unexpected kiss with single mum Terri, while Danny struggles to say the right thing to Zoe. Anna tries to share Harding's enthusiasm for the relaunch of Goddard's, and disaster strikes for two passengers on the way to the ceremony. Drama, with Lesley Dunlop

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: African wildlife drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson as vet Danny Trevanion and Amanda Holden as his new bride Sarah, who set out to build a new life for themselves and their children amid the teeming wildlife of the African plains. With Lucy-Jo Hudson

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A mysterious delivery causes Poirot to recall the time his supper at a Buenos Aires restaurant was rudely interrupted by the murder of a fellow diner, who unwittingly drank from a glass laced with cyanide. Drama, starring David Suchet and Philip Jackson

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike uncovers a case of blackmail involving a newcomer to Aidensfield and Greengrass does a roaring trade in tinned meat until his customers discover what is in it. Rural drama, starring Jason Durr

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Chris tries to tell his sister everything, but she won't let him speak. Zoe strikes a deal with Scott to keep him away from Jean, and Katie gets her exam results

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Chris receives the devastating news that his tumour is inoperable and realises it's time he told his family about his illness, but back at Home Farm, Charity is nowhere to be seen

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Peter plays with fire by telling Shelley he is having a night out with the lads, when really he is meeting Lucy for a drink

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Dev tries to kiss Geena during their romantic evening together, Shelley calls Peter while he is with Lucy, and Les and Kirk turn their house into a love-nest

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is delighted that his heroes Hired Gun are reuniting to play at the Midsomer Rocks festival - minus their drummer, who disappeared 30 years ago after driving his car into a quarry. However, a string of bizarre warnings convinces the paranoid lead singer that someone is trying to stop the reunion, and his fears are confirmed when the backing singer drops dead on stage. Radio 2 host Suzi Quatro guest stars

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Robert has to make what could be a far-reaching decision about the recent bombshell. Rose, meanwhile, seems more concerned with persuading him to buy a wireless than what is happening to those around her - but then again, she's always been trapped in her own self-centred little world. In the kitchen, Mrs Patmore thinks she may have found a way to help Daisy cope with her studies, while Thomas' devious ways look set to scupper Baxter's friendship with Molesley. Finally, as Lord Merton continues to woo Isobel, Anna is reluctantly drawn into Mary's latest scheme

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The kidnapping of a girl leads the police to uncover a secret obsession, while Greengrass takes on more than he can handle in the form of a furry house guest. Rural police drama, starring Jason Durr, Derek Fowlds and Bill Maynard

programme.title: McDonald & Dodds
programme.desc: A young woman dies in a busy park in broad daylight, so Dodds are called in to untangle the mysterious circumstances of her death. Who is she? How did she die surrounded by witnesses? And how is it possible that she appears to be smiling? Evidence leads to Professor George Gillan, a linguistic anthropologist who lives in a rambling mansion with his eccentric mother, whose 100th birthday is days away. Dodds is sure that the house has something to do with the murder, but in uncovering its history, Dodds also unearths secrets in his own past. Return of the crime drama, starring Jason Watkins and Tala Gouveia, with guest appearances by Alan Davies, Catherine Tyldesley and Sian Phillips

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: When an unpopular pub landlord is beaten to death, a police informant casts suspicion on his ex-wife and her new husband. It seems like an open-and-shut case - but Lane badly mishandles the entire investigation, forcing Wycliffe and Kersey to intervene. Jack Shepherd stars as the Cornish copper

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The collapse of a seemingly airtight prosecution case reflects badly on the detective, and it is not long before the media are baying for his blood. To make matters worse, a previous investigation comes back to haunt him, and Lane gets caught in the crossfire. Drama, starring Jack Shepherd, Jimmy Yuill and Helen Masters

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Skelthwaite is buzzing on Luke and Megan's wedding day, but there's more in store for the guests than many anticipated.
